f62a7bc46e3ad48e1ef57662bd202abb.title: It was sex all the time at this 1800s commune, with anyone you wanted and none of the guilt

paragraphs.name: a721
paragraphs.text: Young Oneida men, as they entered puberty, were initiated by an older woman in what we call ‘coitus reservatus,’ withdrawing before orgasm — sort of tantric sex a la upstate New York. I think even coming to orgasm was a no-no, but I may be wrong. Impregnation without the committee’s approval was a definite no-no, but to their credit they did produce…

paragraphs.text: Each generation thinks it has invented sex. There have been many other groups, clubs, cultures and organizations with the same ideas as Oneida going back thousands of years. As the Bible says, there is no new thing under the sun.

28c2ea59e84d.title: Each generation thinks it has invented sex.

paragraphs.name: bbab
paragraphs.text: President Garfield’s assassin, Charles Guiteau, spent five years at Oneida. He was generally spurned and nicknamed “Charles Gitout.” How weird do you have to be not to fit in to a 19th century free love commune? Weird enough to think the public would force his release from jail.

2f387d13adf9.title: President Garfield’s assassin, Charles Guiteau, spent five years at Oneida.

paragraphs.text: I’ve just been reading Candice Millard’s “Destiny of the Republic,” about the assassination of President Garfield. The shooter, Charles Gatineau, was a sometime resident of the Oneida Community, and struggled because free love was allowed but none of the Oneida ladies would have him.
